channel.title: side on Recipes
channel.description: Recent content in side on Recipes

item.title: baked plantains
item.description: 4 ripe plantains 1-2 pounds of cheese broken into long slices butter Peel the plantains. Once peeled cut down center. Bake, after filling with cheese, in a mold with butter. Once golden, prepare a white syrup and serve.

item.title: bean omelette
item.description: 1 pound of beans 2 crumbled chorizos 3 beaten eggs 1 teaspoon grated onion 1-4 teaspoon pepper butter Soften the beans and mash them. Add the other ingredients and mix. Put enough butter in the pan to cover the bottom. Pour into the pan, cover and simmer, come back and brown on both sides.

item.title: beef a la parisienne
item.description: 1 1/2 pounds steak meat (beefsteak) 2 cloves of garlic 1 teaspoon salt 3/4 teaspoon pepper black powder 1 teaspoon lemon juice 1 teaspoon cider vinegar 1/2 teaspoon powders chili 1 teaspoon split oregano leaves 2 8-ounce cans of tomato sauce Cut the meat into 4 servings. Mash the garlic and mix with the salt and pepper. Adobe the meat with this everywhere. Combine lemon juice and vinegar, chili powders and oregano.

item.title: brain sandwiches
item.description: 1 large brain 200 grams of flour 2 egg yolk milk Prepare a large brain, removing the skin and cooking it in water and salt drain it and cut it into pieces. Put in a bowl the flour, yolks and milk in sufficient quantity to form a soft preparation mix well, add the brains, fry them by tablespoons in hot oil and over moderate heat.

item.title: chard salad
item.description: 2 mallets of chards 2 cups of water 1 tablespoon of salt 1/2 cup of oil 1/4 cup of vinegar 1 teaspoon of salt 1/4 teaspoon of pepper Wash and boil the chards, for no more than 5 minutes, in pieces and mix in the oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper. Garnish with rings of onions and tomato.

item.title: corncakes
item.description: 2 cups corn flour 4 cups of water 1 teaspoon salt 1 pound of pork 1 onion 2 ounces of ham 3 tablespoons lard 1 pepper 1 tomato 1 teaspoon salt lard Prepare a hard funche using flour, water and salt. Grind the other ingredients into the machine and add the salt. Simmer. Season at ease. On a greased banana leaf, pour two tablespoons of funche and spread it in a circle.

item.title: creamy pumpkin soup
item.description: 3 cups of mashed pumpkin 3 cups bechamel sauce 1 small onion, grated Add onion and bechemel sauce to mashed pumpkin. Bring to a boil and season at ease. Strain and or broth. Serve callente with crackers or toasted bread.

item.title: creole beef gumbo
item.description: 1 cup celery with its leaves, cut 2 tablespoons butter 2 1/2 cups chopped tomato 8 cups of water 1 1/4 cup rice 1 1/2 cups onion, chopped fine 1 tablespoon sugar 4 teaspoons salt 1/2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce Sauté the celery in butter for 3 minutes. Put the tomato and water. Bring to a boil, pour the onion, sugar, salt and English sauce. Bring to a boil for 30 minutes.

item.title: frog legs a la Béarnaise
item.description: 8 very fresh frog legs Go out at ease Pepper to taste Oil 3 fresh tomatoes 1 cup white wine Lemon juice (in abundance) The legs are seasoned well and sautéed with the oil. Then add the chopped fresh tomato and white wine and lemon juice. Let cool with some fine chopped herbs. Serve in shells.

item.title: gazpacho
item.description: 1 clove of garlic 1-4 teaspoon peppercorns 1-2 teaspoon salt 3 tablespoons of oil 4 cups of water 2 tablespoons vinegar 4 chopped tomatoes 2 chopped onions 2 chopped pickles 2 peppers, chopped Grind the garlic along with the pepper, salt and add the oil, water and vinegar. Strain and add to chopped vegetables. Put in the fridge for several hours and add slices of bread before serving.

item.title: gypsy eggs
item.description: regular amount of oil two garlic 10 or 12 peeled almonds a little piece of bread a few strands of saffron 1-2 teaspoons of cumin a little cinnamon powder boiling water salt 7 eggs In a regular amount of oil we will start by frying two garlic, 10 or 12 peeled almonds, a piece of bread, removing when it is browned. In an almirez you start by crushing a few strands of saffron 1-2 teaspoon of cumin, a little cinnamon powder then the garlic, almonds and bread, soaking with drops of the same oil.

item.title: Italian rice
item.description: 1-2 pound chopped onions 4 tablespoons butter 4 ounces of broken ham 3 split tomatoes 3 split anchovies 1-1-2 pounds of rice 3 cups chicken broth 1 minced chicken breast 1-2 cup grated parmesan cheese Brown the onions and add the ham, tomatoes, anchovies, and sauté. Add the rice, stir and sauté. Add the broth and chicken. When the rice is almost dry, add the cheese, stir, pour into a grease mold and sprinkle with ground cracker.

item.title: jackfruit pancakes
item.description: 2 cups boiled jackfruit 2 tablespoons butter 1-2 teaspoon salt 2 tablespoons grated cheese 1 beaten egg Mash the jackfruit, add the salt and butter and mix well. Add the egg, salt and cheese Shape it into small cakes and fry in hot, hearty butter.

item.title: liver fillets
item.description: liver fillets flour salt oil a bay leaf, 50 grams of butter a glass of Marsala wine cooked spinach lard cooked potatoes Cut some liver fillets by touching the telita and nerves and pass them through flour and season with salt. Put in a frying pan half a cup of oil, heat well and brown the encores then add a bay leaf, 50 grams of butter, a glass of Marsala wine, cover and let it boil slowly until the fillets are cooked and the sauce reduced.

item.title: peasant stew
item.description: 1 cup chickpeas 1 cup peas 3 red chorizos 1 teaspoon oregano 2 bay leaflets 1 sprig of parsley 1 onion 1 pepper oil salt Chickpeas and peas are left to soak from the day before, after washing them well. They are brought to a boil in the same water in which they have dawned. When they take point, the bay leaf, oregano, parsley are added, the onion and peppers are chopped and sautéed in oil with a pinch of salt and this is added along with the chorizos in pieces.

item.title: potato cake
item.description: 2 pounds of potatoes 1 teaspoon salt 2 beaten eggs 4 tablespoons flour 2 cups minced meat filling Boil and mash the potatoes. Add salt, eggs, and flour. Divide into two portions. Put a part in a greased mold so that it shakes the entire mold. Pour the picadillo and spread it and rub with the rest of the potatoes. Cook in a moderate oven at 350 degrees F for 30 or 40 minutes.

item.title: potato cream soup
item.description: 6 tablespoons butter 2 teaspoons salt 1-4 teaspoon pepper 3 tablespoons tri flour go 6 cups of hot milk 1 tablespoon grated onion 2 cups mashed potatoes Prepare the bechamel by melting the butter. Add salt, pepper and flour and stir until it forms a pass. Pour the hot milk and onion and move constantly. When it boils add the mashed potatoes. Serve hot.

item.title: potato fritters
item.description: 1 1-2 pounds of potatoes 1 tablespoon salt 2 eggs 1 cup grated cheese 1-2 pound butter Boil and mash the potatoes. Add the eggs and cheese and fry in butter.

item.title: potato salad
item.description: 6 cups cooked potatoes and diced 1 1/2 cup chopped celery 6 tablespoons pepper, chopped 3/4 cup Kraft Mayonnaise 1 tablespoon of onion or garlic salt if you prefer freshly ground pepper lettuce hard-boiled eggs 7 slices of sausage 6 tablespoons tomato dressing Stir the potatoes, celery and pepper with the mayonnaise. Salt and pepper are added to taste. Put a mound of salad on arranged lettuce on a plate.

item.title: rice croquettes
item.description: 2 cups cooked white rice 1/4 teaspoon salt 1 beaten egg 1/2 teaspoon pepper 2 tablespoons chopped parsley 3 tablespoons of milk 1 cup cracker meal or toast Add egg, pepper, salt, parsley, and milk to cooked rice. Form the croquettes and sprinkle with the cracker meal. Fry them in hot and abundant butter and drain them on absorbent paper. Cheese can be used instead of parsley.

item.title: rice with sausages
item.description: sofrito 5 split sausages 1 1-2 pounds of rice 1 teaspoon salt 3 tablespoons butter with annotto 3 cups water Add the sausages, rice and butter with sofrito and cook for two minutes. Add the water and season to taste. Cook until the rice is a little dry, lower the heat, stir two or three times and keep covered until serving.

item.title: seafood salad
item.description: 1 can of salmon 3 cooked potatoes 2 hard-boiled eggs 6 green and 6 black olives thin slices of onion lettuce leaves 1-2 cup oil 1 teaspoon salt the juice of a lemon 1 tomato in a dish, lettuce leaves, on top of thinly sliced potatoes, onion, salmon season with salt, oil and lemon and garnish with tomato, hard-boiled egg slices and olives.

item.title: sweet potato pudding
item.description: 1 pound sweet potato boiled and mashed 1-2 cup sugar 1-4 teaspoon cinnamon 1-4 cup wheat flour 1-4 cup milk 2 tablespoons butter melted 2 beaten eggs 1-4 teaspoon salt Mix the ingredients in the order they appear, beat to join them well. Pour into an engrated mold and cook in a moderate heat oven for 20 to 30 minutes.

item.title: tomatoes a la mireille
item.description: 6 tomatoes 1 onion 3 eggplants 1 garlic 1 cup white wine 3 egg yolks parsley 1 cup grated cheese cookie powder salt Tomatoes are divided into two and are emptied, seasoned with salt and pepper. They are fried with the onion cut into small pieces the eggplant in thin slices. They are sprinkled with white wine. Add the salt to taste, parsley and grated cheese. Let it cool and add the three egg yolks Tomatoes are stuffed and sprinkled with cookie powder They are placed in a mold, sprinkled with grated Parmesan cheese and au gratin in the oven for 5 minutes.
